intro: Dichiloboea glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular-leaf dichiloboea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along streambanks. Due to its ornamental value and unique morphology, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
